      • getSerialNumberOctetSizeForExistingCa

        public static int getSerialNumberOctetSizeForExistingCa()
        Returns:
        The length in octets of certificate serial numbers generated for legacy CAs. (8 octets is a 64 bit serial number.)

      • getSerialNumberOctetSizeForNewCa

        public static int getSerialNumberOctetSizeForNewCa()

      • getCaSerialNumberAlgorithm

        public static String getCaSerialNumberAlgorithm()
        Returns:
        The algorithm that should be used to generate random numbers (Random Number Generator Algorithm)

      • getCaTooLateExpireDate

        public static String getCaTooLateExpireDate()
        Returns:
        The date and time from which an expire date of a certificate is to be considered to be too far in the future.

      • getCertificateValidityOffset

        public static String getCertificateValidityOffset()
        The relative time offset for the notBefore value of CA and end entity certificates. Changing this value, also changes the notAfter attribute of the certificates, if a relative time is used for its validity. While certificate issuance this value can be overwritten by the corresponding value in the certificate profile used.
        Returns:
        offset
        See Also:
        CertificateProfile.getCertificateValidityOffset(), SimpleTime

      • isPermitExtractablePrivateKeys

        public static boolean isPermitExtractablePrivateKeys()
        Returns:
        true if it is permitted to use an extractable private key in a HSM.

      • getInternalResourcesPreferredLanguage

        public static String getInternalResourcesPreferredLanguage()
        Returns:
        The language that should be used internally for logging, exceptions and approval notifications.

      • getInternalResourcesSecondaryLanguage

        public static String getInternalResourcesSecondaryLanguage()
        Returns:
        The language used internally if a resource not found in the preferred language

      • isDevelopmentProviderInstallation

        public static boolean isDevelopmentProviderInstallation()
        Flag indicating if the BC provider should be removed before installing it again. When developing and re-deploying alot this is needed so you don't have to restart JBoss all the time. In production it may cause failures because the BC provider may get removed just when another thread wants to use it. Therefore the default value is false.
        Returns:
        flag

      • getCacheCaTimeInCaSession

        public static long getCacheCaTimeInCaSession()
        Returns:
        Parameter to specify if retrieving CAInfo and CA from CAAdminSession should be cached, and in that case for how long.

      • getCacheTimeCryptoToken

        public static long getCacheTimeCryptoToken()
        Returns:
        configuration for when cached CryptoTokens are considered stale and will be refreshed from the database.

      • getCacheTimeInternalKeyBinding

        public static long getCacheTimeInternalKeyBinding()
        Returns:
        configuration for when cached SignersMapping are considered stale and will be refreshed from the database.

      • getTrustedTimeNtpCommand

        public static String getTrustedTimeNtpCommand()
        Returns:

      • isKeepInternalCAKeystores

        public static boolean isKeepInternalCAKeystores()
        Option if we should keep internal CA keystores in the CAData table to be compatible with CeSecore 1.1/EJBCA 5.0. Default to true. Set to false when all nodes in a cluster have been upgraded to CeSecore 1.2/EJBCA 5.1 or later, then internal keystore in CAData will be replaced with a foreign key in to the migrated entry in CryptotokenData.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • getNodeIdentifier

        public static String getNodeIdentifier()
        When we run in a cluster, each node should have it's own identifier. By default we use the DNS name.
        Returns:
        ID

      • getAvailableCipherSuites

        public static String[] getAvailableCipherSuites()
        Returns:
        a list of enabled TLS protocol versions and cipher suites

      • getCTCacheMaxEntries

        public static long getCTCacheMaxEntries()
        Gets the maximum number of entries in the CT cache. Each entry contains the SCTs for a given certificate. Each SCT will be around 100-150 bytes, and a certificate will typically have 2-4 SCTs. Also, the cache may temporarily overshoot by 50%. There's also some overhead for the cache data structure (ConcurrentCache). -1 means no limit (and not "off"). The default is 100 000.
        Returns:
        max entries
        See Also:
        getCTCacheEnabled()

      • getCTCacheCleanupInterval

        public static long getCTCacheCleanupInterval()
        Returns:
        How many milliseconds between periodic cache cleanup. The cleanup routine is only run when the cache is filled with too many entries.

      • getCTCacheEnabled

        public static boolean getCTCacheEnabled()
        Returns:
        Whether caching of SCTs should be enabled. The default is true.

      • getCTFastFailEnabled

        public static boolean getCTFastFailEnabled()
        Returns:
        Whether log availability should be tracked, and requests should "fast fail" whenever a log is known to be down. A log is "known to be down" when it is either unreachable or responds with an HTTP error status to a request.

      • getCTFastFailBackOff

        public static long getCTFastFailBackOff()
        Returns:
        How long time (in milliseconds) EJBCA should wait until trying to use a log which has failed to respond to a request.

      • makeKeyUnmodifiableAfterGeneration

        public static boolean makeKeyUnmodifiableAfterGeneration()
        Returns:
        true if key should be unmodifiable after generation.
